key_points: Douglas Kantor, a 25-year-old tourist from Michigan, was killed in a shooting in Austin's Sixth Street entertainment district.
Kantor worked as a product manager for Ford Motor Company's IT department.
The shooting left 13 bystanders injured; Kantor succumbed to his injuries a day later.
Austin police believe the shooting was an isolated incident between two parties.
Kantor was set to marry his high school sweetheart, Adrianna Esposito, and had recently purchased his first home.
Two suspects have been arrested in connection to the shooting, a 17-year-old charged as an adult and another juvenile.
Austin Interim Police Chief Joe Chacon indicated the shooters could face charges including attempted murder and aggravated assault with a deadly weapon.
Nick Kantor, Douglas' brother, criticized efforts to defund the police, attributing his brother's death partly to a lack of resources for police.
Officials are considering additional charges for the suspects, with the investigation ongoing into who fired the shots.
The incident is still under investigation as police search for the second suspect and finalize charges.
spokespersons: Leo Kempel (Dean, Michigan State University College of Engineering)
